gecko_cli package¶

Submodules¶

gecko_cli.colours module¶

class gecko_cli.colours.ColouredWriter[source]¶

Bases: object

Simplifies the use of coloured text and highlighting in a terminal.

write(text, colour=None, on_colour=None, attrs=None, end='\n')[source]¶

Write text to the terminal.

Args:
text (str): the text to write. colour (str): the colour of the text. on_colour (str): the colour of the text background/highlighting. attrs (str): extra properties such as bold or italics. end (str): added to the end of text.

Returns: None

gecko_cli.screen module¶

class gecko_cli.screen.Screen(title, information, function=<function dummy_function>, args=(), wrap=False, wrap_width=os.terminal_size(columns=92, lines=39))[source]¶

Bases: object

Callable menu or screen.

Makes use of keywords in the form @KEYWORD@ which are replaced when the screen is drawn. These are used to display dynamic information such as the current time.

gecko_cli.screen.dummy_function()[source]¶

Placeholder function.

Returns: None

gecko_cli.screen.formatted_input(msg)[source]¶

Removes whitespace from the beginning and start of a string and makes it lower-case. Used to allow easier processing of input such as commands.

Args:
msg (str): the text to format.

Returns: str

gecko_cli.screen.suggest_closest(msg, matches, the_window, closest=True)[source]¶

Wrapper around the terminator.find_closest function that gets input and asks the user for confirmation on the correction.

Args:
msg (str): the message to display when waiting for input. matches (iterable): iterable containing the possible matches. the_window (terminator.TerminalWindow): window object for IO. closest (bool): if True, forces a match in matches.

Returns: str

gecko_cli.screen.updater(period, function=None)[source]¶

Periodically calls a function. Useful if you want to periodically refresh a screen (e.g. for a clock).

Args:
period (int): the number of seconds between each function call. function: the function to call.

Returns: threading.Thread

gecko_cli.terminator module¶

class gecko_cli.terminator.DrawQueue(window)[source]¶

Bases: object

add_draw(func, args=())[source]¶

Add a draw call to the queue.

Args:
func (callable or str): the function to call or string to print. args (tuple): the arguments to give the function when it is called.

Returns: None

next()[source]¶

Attempts to make the next draw call in the queue.

Returns: None

class gecko_cli.terminator.TerminalWindow(wrap=False, wrap_width=os.terminal_size(columns=92, lines=39))[source]¶

Bases: object

Flexible terminal interface that gives greater control over how text is displayed.

bg_colour(colour)[source]¶

Changes the background colour of future text.

Args:
colour (str): the colour to change the background colour to. Must exist in self._VALID_COLOURS.

Returns: None

clear_buffer()[source]¶

Clears screen data so it will be clear if the terminal is redrawn.

Returns: None

clear_screen()[source]¶

Clears the terminal and screen data.

Returns: None

clear_terminal()[source]¶

Clears the terminal window. Screen data is not affected.

Returns: None

count_lines()[source]¶

Counts the number of lines in the screen data.

Returns: int

delete_previous()[source]¶

Removes the previous line in screen data.

Returns: None

fg_colour(colour)[source]¶

Changes the colour of future text.

Args:
colour (str): the colour to change the text colour to. Must exist in self._VALID_COLOURS.

Returns: None

input(text='', keep_input=True)[source]¶

Gets user input.

Args:
text (str): the text to prompt user input. keep_input (bool): if true, the user input is added to the screen data (stays on redraw).

Returns: str

insert(text, xy)[source]¶

Insert the text at position xy, where the greater the y value, the lower the height.

Args:
text (str): the text to insert. xy (tuple): tuple containing x and y integer coordinates.

Returns: None

lock(the_id)[source]¶

Locks the TerminalWindow object to prevent other threads from changing the screen. This is not enforced - it is either used by the Screen class or implemented by the user.

Args:
the_id (int): the id of the function obtaining the lock.

Returns: None

print(text='', end='\n')[source]¶

Displays text to the terminal. The text is added to the screen data so that if the terminal is re-drawn the text will still be displayed.

Args:
text (str): the text to be displayed. end (str): additional string to display at the end of a line. This is not added to the screen data.

Returns: None

redraw()[source]¶

Clear the terminal then re-writes screen data.

Returns: None

unlock()[source]¶

Unlocks the TerminalWindow.

Returns: None

gecko_cli.terminator.find_closest(text, values, closest=False)[source]¶

Finds closest match to text in values.

Args:
text (str): the string to find matches for. values (iterable): iterable containing possible matches. closest (bool): if False only returns exact matches.

Returns: str

gecko_cli.terminator.get_char()[source]¶

Gets a single character from standard input.

Returns: str

gecko_cli.terminator.index_from_end(list1, value)[source]¶

Finds the index of the first match of value in list starting from the end and working backwards.

Args:
list1 (iterable): iterable to find match in. value:

Returns: int

Module contents¶

Simple and powerful library for creating interactive terminal programs with Python.

Created by Aidan Redding.
